title: Domain 1.1: Explain concepts related to the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) reference model.
content:
This is the physical medium through which data travels. It includes cables, switches, and the electrical signals that transmit data.

Examples:

  • Ethernet cables
  • Fiber optics
  • Wi-Fi signals

🏗️ Layer 2: Data Link

Responsible for node-to-node data transfer and error correction. It frames data for the network layer and handles MAC addresses.

Examples:

  • Ethernet
  • Wi-Fi
  • MAC addresses

🌍 Layer 3: Network

Handles routing and forwarding data between devices on different networks using IP addresses.

Examples:

  • IP
  • Routers
  • IPv4
  • IPv6

🚚 Layer 4: Transport

Ensures reliable data transmission between systems, including flow control, error correction, and session management.

Examples:

  • TCP
  • UDP

📁 Layer 5: Session

Manages sessions between applications on different devices. It controls dialog, synchronization, and data exchange.

Examples:

  • NetBIOS
  • RPC (Remote Procedure Call)

💻 Layer 6: Presentation

Formats or translates data to be understood by the application layer. It deals with encryption, compression, and data representation.

Examples:

  • SSL/TLS
  • JPEG
  • ASCII

🖥️ Layer 7: Application

The top layer where end-user applications interact with the network. It enables services like email, file transfer, and web browsing.

Examples:

  • HTTP
  • FTP
  • DNS
  • POP3
  • SMTP
